name: Congenital Ventricular Septal Aneurysm with Eisenmenger Syndrome
chief_complaint: My child gets tired very quickly and turns blue when playing
prognosis: Poor without intervention; progressive pulmonary hypertension leads to right heart failure
description: A rare congenital cardiac anomaly where a ventricular septal aneurysm develops in utero, later causing right-to-left shunting and Eisenmenger physiology due to irreversible pulmonary vascular disease. The aneurysm tissue is thin and may contain perforations.
multiple_choice: Congenital Ventricular Septal Aneurysm with Eisenmenger Syndrome
Atrial Septal Defect with Pulmonary Hypertension
